means: 解放某人（尤指摆脱政治、法律或社会的束缚）( emancipate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: That war preserved the Union and emancipated the slaves.
sentence.Network_cn: 那场战争保住了联邦政府，并解放了奴隶。
她是个不被传统束缚的女性。
天主教徒在1792年获得了解放。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(44) _ 上海疯狂英语 ... emancipate 释放 emancipated 被解放的 emancipation 释放.
septal 中隔的,间隔的emancipated 被解放的,不受约束的autologous 自体移植的; 从自身取得的
sunny period... ... 教学实验 Teaching experiment 翻身 emancipated 不在去爱，也不敢爱。 Not to love,did not dare to love.
I ' m sure you two emancipated females will take this in your stride ., 我相信你们两位摆脱束缚的女性会从容地对付此事的.

list.abs: he believes very strongly in female emancipation ., 他强烈主张妇女解放.
...犹太解放运动（Jewish emancipation）是欧洲犹太人权利自18世纪起从外在和阿什肯纳兹犹太人|内在同时争取的这一进程。包括同等公民权利的认定，以及个人公民身份的授予等。成果来自于社区内的努力，使得得以整合进入社会而成为公民。这一运动随着启蒙时代与同时期的哈斯卡拉运动|犹太启蒙运动开始，自18世纪末起.
商贸中... ... 三通一平 three side connections and one site leveling 解放思想 emancipate minds “一刀切” impose uniformity.
1862年9月22日,林肯总统颁发《解放黑人奴隶宣言》(emancipation proclamation),目前世界上最强大的国家从轨制上纯粹拔除奴隶制。1863年1月1日又正式号令解放奴隶。

entry.tran: 获得解放的;不受束缚的
entry.def: If you describe someone as emancipated, you mean that they behave in a less restricted way than is traditional in their society.

example.tran: 她是个不被传统束缚的女性。

sentences.sentence: "an emancipated young woman pursuing her career"

auth_sentence.content: Drastic measures were necessary to protect the emancipated Negro.
auth_sentence.res_content: Drastic measures were necessary to protect the emancipated Negro.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Drastic measures were necessary to protect the emancipated Negro.

auth_sentence.content: Mimi may not be entirely emancipated from her past, but this is certainly one big step out of the mire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mimi may not be entirely emancipated from her past, but this is certainly one big step out of the mire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mimi may not be entirely emancipated from her past, but this is certainly one big step out of the mire.
